intro: Osbornia octodonta, commonly known as the eight-toothed osbornia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Osbornia octodonta thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical studies.
